Notes: AlJazeera Nov 13: "Bangladesh has extended its closure of schools and educational institutions, which were last open in March, until December 19. The government closed schools and educational institutions on March 17 and has extended the closure several times, most recently until November 15."    https://web.archive.org/web/20201122211406/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/11/13/bangladesh-extends-school-shutdown-over-second-covid-19-wave

Targeted: According to the US Embassy Website in Bangladesh as of Nov 11, 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20201111005505/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/:   "Currently, only certain sectors located within the Wari jurisdiction of the Dhaka South City Corporation are designated as ‘lockdown/containment’ zones. In these areas, the City Corporations will facilitate emergency response services.    Restrictions on Designated Lockdown/Containment Areas:  - Pedestrian and vehicular movements controlled through secured entry/exit points.  - Residents should remain within their homes except for emergencies or for essential needs.  - No indoor dining services allowed. Delivery food service options are available.  - Grocery stores and pharmacies will remain open.  - Residents will be allowed to shop in bazaars only when necessary.  - Residents must work from home.  - Transportation will be suspended. Rickshaws, vans, taxis, auto-rickshaws, and private vehicles are not permitted inside the demarcated areas during the 21-day lockdown.  - COVID-19 tests will be available to residents, and home isolation or institutional isolation will be arranged for patients who test positive.  - Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes and recreation centres will be closed.  - No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  - Only people who are ill may go to hospitals.  - Mosques and other places of worship are closed to residents. Only official staff are permitted to enter.  - ATM services will remain open. Banks will operate in a limited capacity.  - Factories in towns will remain closed, but factories and agricultural production-related factories in rural areas can remain operational.  - Agricultural work must be performed under strict health and hygiene regulations."    This information has not changed as of Nov 18, 2020: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122221519/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Targeted: According to the US Embassy Website in Bangladesh as of Nov 11, 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20201111005505/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/:   "Currently, only certain sectors located within the Wari jurisdiction of the Dhaka South City Corporation are designated as ‘lockdown/containment’ zones. In these areas, the City Corporations will facilitate emergency response services.    It is important to note GoB officials have confirmed that the list of Red zones does not mean the areas are or will be under lockdown restrictions.    Restrictions on Designated Lockdown/Containment Areas:  - Pedestrian and vehicular movements controlled through secured entry/exit points.  - Residents should remain within their homes except for emergencies or for essential needs.  - No indoor dining services allowed. Delivery food service options are available.  - Grocery stores and pharmacies will remain open.  - Residents will be allowed to shop in bazaars only when necessary.  - Residents must work from home.  - Transportation will be suspended. Rickshaws, vans, taxis, auto-rickshaws, and private vehicles are not permitted inside the demarcated areas during the 21-day lockdown.  - COVID-19 tests will be available to residents, and home isolation or institutional isolation will be arranged for patients who test positive.  - Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes and recreation centres will be closed.  - No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  - Only people who are ill may go to hospitals.  - Mosques and other places of worship are closed to residents. Only official staff are permitted to enter.  - ATM services will remain open. Banks will operate in a limited capacity.  - Factories in towns will remain closed, but factories and agricultural production-related factories in rural areas can remain operational.  - Agricultural work must be performed under strict health and hygiene regulations."    This information has not changed as of Nov 18, 2020: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122221519/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The British government has noted that the UK is amongst some of the few countries where commercial passenger flights have resumed. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201205202636/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bangladesh/coronavirus

"The Prime Minister also announced that the government would cover Tk. 20 billion in interest payments on behalf of 13.8 million loan recipients negatively impacted by the national shutdown."    As of December 3rd, 2020 it appears that these debt relief programs are still ongoing.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201213134019/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
No policy change identified.

As of December 5th, testing of symptomatic individuals continues.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201213140121/https://www.dhakatribune.com/health/coronavirus/2020/12/02/bangladesh-to-start-antigen-testing-from-december-5

No policy change identified.     https://web.archive.org/web/20201213140430/https://www.who.int/bangladesh/news/detail/06-09-2020-who-strengthens-covid-19-contact-tracing-to-break-the-chain-of-transmission

As part of COVID-19 measures, face masks must be worn at all times when moving in and around Bangladesh. This includes wearing a mask inside all workplaces (public and private), educational institutions, places of worship, hotels, shops, malls, markets, restaurants, hospitals and at social gatherings. You should also wear a mask at home if anyone in your household is displaying COVID-19 symptoms.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201213135559/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bangladesh/coronavirus
No Change

Notification-on-reopening-of-schools-for-2021  http://web.archive.org/save/http://www.education.gov.bt/wpcontent/uploads/2020/10/Notificcation-on-reopening-of-schools-for-2021.pdf  This is to update the public that the lockdown is extended to the super zones, which includes Thimphu throm and peripheral areas of Debsi, RTC area, Gangchey, Nyezergang in the south, Kabesa, Begana and Changtagang in the north. Until further notice, all shops, offices, schools and institutions in the Thimphu Super Zone must remain closed. This is a complete lockdown and there will be no delivery of essentials for now. Depending on the surveillance outcome, the zone wise relaxations and essential supplies will be carried out in the coming days. Toll free line 1010 has been activated to answer to your queries.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221171405/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/20-12-20-thimphu-thromde-under-lock-down-national-covid-19-task-forcenc19tf/  http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/20-12-20-update-on-thimphu-throm-lockdown-pmo/
No Change

This is to update the public that the lockdown is extended to the super zones, which includes Thimphu throm and peripheral areas of Debsi, RTC area, Gangchey, Nyezergang in the south, Kabesa, Begana and Changtagang in the north. Until further notice, all shops, offices, schools and institutions in the Thimphu Super Zone must remain closed. This is a complete lockdown and there will be no delivery of essentials for now. Depending on the surveillance outcome, the zone wise relaxations and essential supplies will be carried out in the coming days. Toll free line 1010 has been activated to answer to your queries.  In order to prevent spread and assess situations, we will stop all inter-district travel of both vehicles and people with immediate effect. Essential movements and exit of export materials will be facilitated with close monitoring by Royal Bhutan Police.  http://web.archive.org/web/20201221171405/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/20-12-20-thimphu-thromde-under-lock-down-national-covid-19-task-forcenc19tf/  http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/20-12-20-update-on-thimphu-throm-lockdown-pmo/  http://web.archive.org/save/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/22-12-20-inter-dzongkhag-travel-restrictions/
No Change

Required school closures for many levels, especially at a localized levels continues in Sri Lanka.    Notably:  1. Even as the Sri Lankan Govt reopened schools in late November, it permitted schools in certain regions to remain closed until further notice.  - "Education Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris says that schools across the country except the Western Province and selected isolated areas have been reopened for the third term after taking into consideration the concerns, and ensuring that health and safety guidelines are strictly enforced." -- reported on Nov 24, 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20201213194921/http://www.dailynews.lk/2020/11/24/local/234310/safety-schools-ensured-education-minister-prof-gl-peiris#:~:text=Education%2520Minister%2520Prof.%2520G.L.%2520Peiris%2520says%2520that%2520schools,that%2520health%2520and%2520safety%2520guidelines%2520are%2520strictly%2520enforced.    2. All schools were ordered to be closed completely starting on Nov 7 for three days, and the order was later extended to last till Nov 11, 2020.  sources:  - "The Education Department of the Southern Province said that schools in Galle will close for three days from tomorrow (Nov 7, 2020)". https://web.archive.org/web/20201213194640/https://colombogazette.com/2020/12/06/schools-in-galle-to-close-as-coronavirus-spreads/  - "The closure of  schools in the Galle Education Zone will continue till this Friday (Nov 11 2020), Southern Province Education Ministry Secretary Ranjith Yapa said." https://web.archive.org/web/20201213194634/http://www.dailymirror.lk/breaking_news/Closure-of-schools-in-Galle-extended/108-201422    3. Pre-schools in Sri Lanka to reopen only in 2021  Dec 11, 2020: "Pre-Schools will most likely re-open in January 2021, said State Minister of Women and Child Development, Preschools & Primary Education, School Infrastructure & Education Services – Piyal Nishantha De Silva." - https://web.archive.org/web/20201213195651/https://english.siyathanews.lk/2020/12/11/pre-schools-likely-to-open-next-year-min-piyal-nishantha/

School closures in Sri Lanka for specific levels, and in specific regions have been extended well into January 2021.    "Dec 15, Colombo: The Minister of Education Prof. GL Peiris said Monday that steps will be taken to start pre-schools, primary grades in schools and tuition classes in January next year. The dates for their resumption will be announced within two weeks, he said."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104100919/http://www.colombopage.com/archive_20B/Dec15_1608012168CH.php    "Schools in Western Province cannot be reopened on the 11th of January in the wake of the Covid-19 situation that prevails in the region, says Education Minister Prof. G.L. Peiris.  Discussions will be carried out today (31) with regard to the health and safety measures for the schools that are to be reopened on the 11th of January, he said further."   - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104100703/http://www.adaderana.lk/news.php?nid=70376

Targeted lockdowns continue in Sri Lanka, with closures schools, workplaces, public gatherings and restriction on the number of people who can gather, and curfew-style stay-at-home restrictions.     "Dec 17 2020: COLOMBO: Nazeerwatte in the Wellawatte Police Area has been placed under isolation with immediate effect to stop the spread of Covid 19."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104103453/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/12/17/nazeerwatte-in-wellawatte-placed-under-isolation/    "Dec 24 2020: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lankan authorities on Thursday imposed lockdown on three towns on the outskirts of the capital to contain the spread of COVID-19 during the festive season.  Kosgama, Awissawella and Ruwanwella, about 60 kilometers (37 miles) east of Colombo, were locked down from Thursday noon.  Lockdowns have been applied in dozens of towns and villages since a resurgence of the coronavirus in the Indian Ocean island nation in October. Schools and key public offices have been closed, public gatherings banned and restrictions imposed on public transport.   The two clusters that emerged in October — one centered on a garment factory and other on a fish market — account for most of Sri Lanka’s outbreak. The confirmed cases from the two clusters have grown to 34,959 on Thursday. Sri Lanka’s total since March is about 38,600."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104102936/https://apnews.com/article/sri-lanka-coronavirus-pandemic-asia-colombo-asia-pacific-18179ff86b01754480fb3bd2beff8f9b    Other location-specific lockdown press releases (from the middle of December through early January):  - Press Release - 2020.12.17 - Newly isolates Areas - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104103545/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2561-press-release-2020-12-17-newly-isolates-areas  - Press Release - 2020.12.17 - Wellawatta Nafeerwatta area isolated from this moment - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104104509/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2562-press-release-2020-12-17-wellawatta-nafeerwatta-area-isolated-from-this-moment  - Press Release - 2020.12.19 - Thunduwa West and Thunduwa East Grama niladhari Divisions are isolated from this moment - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104104824/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2572-press-release-2020-12-19-thunduwa-west-and-thunduwa-east-grama-niladhari-divisions-are-isolated-from-this-moment  - Press Release - 2020.12.20 - Isolation Lifting, Continuing and Newly isolates Areas - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104104919/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2573-press-release-2020-12-20-isolation-lifting-continuing-and-newly-isolates-areas  - Press Release - 2020.12.24 - Avissawella,Kosgama and Ruwanwella isolated from this moment - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104105203/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2589-press-release-2020-12-24-avissawella-kosgama-and-ruwanwella-isolated-from-this-momentd  - Press Release - 2020.12.25 - Yonakapura East & Yonakapura West isolated from this moment - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104105252/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2593-press-release-2020-12-25-yonakapura-east-yonakapura-west-isolated-from-this-moment  - Press Release - 2020.12.27 - Newly isolates Areas - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104104000/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2601-press-release-2020-12-27-newly-isolates-areas  - Press Release - 2020.12.27 - Isolation Lifting, Continuing and Newly isolates Areas - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104105451/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2600-press-release-2020-12-27-isolation-lifting-continuing-and-newly-isolates-areas  - Press Release -2021.01.01 - Newly Isolated Areas - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104105706/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2619-press-release-2021-01-01-newly-isolated-areas  - Press Release - 2021.01.03 - Isolated lifting and newly isolated areas - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104105600/https://www.dgi.gov.lk/news/press-releases-sri-lanka/2626-press-release-2021-01-03-isolated-lifting-and-newly-isolated-areas

Targeted lockdowns continue in Sri Lanka, with closures schools, workplaces, public gatherings and restriction on the number of people who can gather, and curfew-style stay-at-home restrictions.     "Dec 17 2020: COLOMBO: Nazeerwatte in the Wellawatte Police Area has been placed under isolation with immediate effect to stop the spread of Covid 19."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104103453/https://www.newsfirst.lk/2020/12/17/nazeerwatte-in-wellawatte-placed-under-isolation/    "Dec 24 2020: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka (AP) — Sri Lankan authorities on Thursday imposed lockdown on three towns on the outskirts of the capital to contain the spread of COVID-19 during the festive season.  Kosgama, Awissawella and Ruwanwella, about 60 kilometers (37 miles) east of Colombo, were locked down from Thursday noon.  Lockdowns have been applied in dozens of towns and villages since a resurgence of the coronavirus in the Indian Ocean island nation in October. Schools and key public offices have been closed, public gatherings banned and restrictions imposed on public transport.   The two clusters that emerged in October — one centered on a garment factory and other on a fish market — account for most of Sri Lanka’s outbreak. The confirmed cases from the two clusters have grown to 34,959 on Thursday. Sri Lanka’s total since March is about 38,600."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104102936/https://apnews.com/article/sri-lanka-coronavirus-pandemic-asia-colombo-asia-pacific-18179ff86b01754480fb3bd2beff8f9b    Other location-specific lockdown press releases (from the middle of December through early January):  - While schools were reopened across Nepal towards the last week of November - source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201213212004/https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/schools-reopen-amid-coronavirus-scare/    Some regions were forced to shut down schools again in early December  source: Nov 30, 2020: "Some schools that resumed classes yesterday after a long time due to coronavirus pandemic were closed today in Shambhunath Municipality, Saptari." https://web.archive.org/web/20201213212045/https://thehimalayantimes.com/nepal/schools-closed-day-after-they-opened/

Nepal has written to India, requesting to procure COVID-19 vaccines to inoculate around 20 per cent of its population, the Kathmandu Post reported.    Nepal will pay for the vaccines it sources through India, the paper added.  Actual groups have not been mentioned.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210103220831/https://www.ndtv.com/india-news/nepal-requests-india-to-procure-covid-vaccines-for-20-citizens-report-2345724

"SouthAsiaMonitor.org Jan 3 2021: Pakistan mulls reopening educational institutes in phases: The Pakistan government is mulling the reopening of educational institutions across the country in a phased manner from January 25"  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104222649/https://southasiamonitor.org/index.php/pakistan/pakistan-mulls-reopening-educational-institutes-phases-0    Reporting from Khaleej Times on Nov 23rd: "Pakistan will close down schools, colleges and universities from November 26 in a bid to contain the spread of Covid-19 pandemic. Shafqat Mahmood, Pakistan’s Education Minister, held a press conference on Monday [Nov 23 2020] to announce the details. He said online classes will continue from November 26 to December 24. The educational institutes will be closed from December 25, 2020 to January 10, 2021 for winter vacations." source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201129194756/https://www.khaleejtimes.com/world/rest-of-asia/covid-19-pakistan-announces-closure-of-schools-colleges-universities
No change since last time. Economy, public gatherings and events, and modes of transportation are still open in general, but targeted areas can be put under lockdown with no/little notice.

Gulf News: January 2 2021: "COVID-19: Pakistan to have vaccine by mid-January. Islamabad: Pakistan is likely to have a COVID-19 vaccine by the middle of this month and the Sindh health department has requested people under 59 to volunteer for the vaccine trial."  - https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223114/https://www.msn.com/en-ae/news/other/covid-19-pakistan-to-have-vaccine-by-mid-january/ar-BB1cq22R    Reuters: DECEMBER 30, 2020: "Pakistan to purchase 1.2 million COVID-19 vaccine doses from China's Sinopharm"  https://web.archive.org/web/20210104223142/https://www.reuters.com/article/health-coronavirus-pakistan-vaccine-idUSKBN2950DU
